content.description: sit start on obvious horizontal down low. Work up a series of slopers to a undercling. Move out left to a flake feature and follow this to the mantle on top.
content.location: when facing the block this is the left most problem. Look for the white streaks on the rock.

content.description: Sit start on slopers and work the bulge on decent slopers will take a little thought working from sloper to sloper.A heel can come in handy. Throw for the smooth sloper bulge on the top and mantle over.
content.location: When facing the block this is the problem by the bulging arete to the right.

content.description: Buffalo Ninja will really test your sloper strength. Starts low and works a series of horizontal slots that have slopers through the small bulge of the boulder. Powerful insecure slopers to a fun mantle on the top. Send this or get drop kicked off by the Buffalo Ninja.

The Bison block is a good boulder to test your slopers on. Great quality stone that is slightly bulging on slopers. Sits close to a lot of other developed blocks and i believe the lower path runs right by it. This block sits right below the cliff line and north of The twin Planets area but close proximity to them as well.
